channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2024040447
item.description:
Report E-2024040447

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: MUNSTER
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an 8ft-by-50ft area of the trailer floor and a 25ft-by-100ft area of the concrete lot and estimated that seventy-five (75) gallons of material was released from one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel deployed a granular absorbent and a neutralizer to the impacted areas. The spent material was gathered and containerized into eight (8) 55-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was transported to the local Dayton Freight terminal and placed in a secure location for the terminal to coordinate disposal. The generated waste will remain onsite for the Dayton Freight team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040396
item.description:
Report E-2024040396

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-15
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCW experienced a release from (4) 275-gallon poly totes. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of UN2734 Tri-Act 1800 released from (2) 275-gallon poly totes due to forklift punctures. Approximately 20-gallons of UN2920 Tri-Act 1820 also released from (2) 275-gallon poly totes due to a bent metal cage and a forklift puncture. The products collectively impacted a 6’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor, 20’ x 8’ area of the concrete lot, and a 40’ x 15’ & 10’ x 3’ areas of the concrete dock floor. All 4 totes of material were transferred into new totes for shipment on. Absorbent & citric acid solution were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas to clean and neutralize the release. The damaged totes were then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into (8) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Report E-2024040438

  • City: GREENWOOD

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately twenty (20) gallons of DT-162 Mineral Spirit Solution impacting the trailer floor released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned up the released material and overpacked the damaged drum. Dayton Freight will coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040356
item.description:
Report E-2024040356

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Warehousemen were getting ready to sample a drum of waste and when they opened the bung they noticed a small amount of material starting to leak from a pinhole rust spot in the body of the drum. The drum was immediately overpacked and the spill was cleaned up in house. No material went offsite and all clean up materials were managed as hazardous waste

item.title: Report E-2024040355
item.description:
Report E-2024040355

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading waste drums from a box trailer it was noticed that a drum was leaking. The drum had a hole in the body. It looked like it was hit by another drum during transportation which caused the drum to get a hole and leak. the drum was immediately put in an overpack and the spill was cleaned off. No material was leaked offsite. All cleanup took place in house and cleanup materials was treated as hazardous waste.

item.title: Report E-2024040310
item.description:
Report E-2024040310

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight observed five (5) gallons of material released from one damaged 5-gallon metal pail that impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerized the spent absorbents into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum. Dayton Freight will coordinate disposal.
